bboxes.raw_text:
In memory of our beloved hus-
band. father and grandfather, Ed
ward Harris, who departed from
this world, June 27. 1868.
1t was one year ago
Since you left us here below.
We have thought about you each
day
Remembering some of the words
you say
Knowing you are happy wher-
ever you are.
The depths you left cannot be
filled,
Although we have travelled so far.
Sleep on dear and take your rest.


We loved you,
But. God loved you best.


Mrs. L. G.. Harris,


Rev. and Mrs. R. ]. N. Jones


and family

NEW YORK The NAACP
legal defense fund praised the
Playboy Club Of New Orleans for
it's suit against Louisiana laws
prohibiting Negroes from attend
ing the club.


Jack Creenberg, director
counsel. called the Playboy suit
a major legal step by private
firm aimed at breaking down
racial barriers In the south.


''lt Is encouraging to see a
private corporation invoke the
US. Constitution in seeking to
open Its entertainment facilities
to all citizens" MIR. Greenberg
said.


The Playboy suit also asks the
Court to issue an injunction re-
straining the defendants. who in
clude Governor John McKeithen,
Mayor Victor Schiro, and other
state and city officials. from
enforcing the discriminatory
laws or the segregationist pol
icies they embody.


Playboy International. which
supervises the operations Of the
Playboy Clubs in eight cities.
has 100000 "key holders" in
the nation including many Me-
groes.


Any "key holder" is entitled
to the full privileges Of all Play
boy Clubs. regardless ofhis place
Of residence. The Louisiana stat
ute and New Orleans ordinance
challenged this week make tim
possible for the New Orleans
Club or its manager to admit
Negroes without riskng fines
from $l00 to $1,000, jail term
ranging from 90 days to one
year, and loss of liquor license.

Plu yboy Club
Sued For Bios

COOK, VS., $3.50 PER HOUR
Apply at: Davis-Monthan Air
Force Base, Arizona and other
federal agencies in the Tucson
area.


Experience Requirements: APP
plicants must have had one year
of progressively responsible ex-
perience in general cooking in a
restaurant. hotel, hospital. resi-
dent school, or institution, which
must have included six months
experience in Quantity cook
ing. Quantity cooking is de-
fined as experience In cooking
which required the preparation
and serving Of at least 200 meals
daily.


Submit completed SF-57 Jap
plication for Federal Employ
ment) and GAG Card Form 500l
BE to: Executive Secretary,
Board of US. Civil Service Ex-
aminers, Davis-Monthan Air
Force Base, Arizona. 85707.

Mrs. Jay Frame. Of Marion,
Ohio. spent two weeks with her
son and daughter in law. Mr.. and
Mrs. Martin Stevens on.


Misses Dorothy Echols, Sharon
Brooks, Loretta Orme and Jackie
Laster, spent the 4th Of July in
Payson.


Mr.. and Mrs. Leroy alker and
son are on their way to Chicago.
They will spend few days in
Fresno, Calf.


Mrs. Ernestine Davis, Of Las
Vegas, Is visiting the L. G. Rus
sell family.


Miss Annetta Faye Hawkins at
tended family reunion at Flag
staff, Arizona.


Mrs. Pearl Norman went home
to San Diego by way of San An
tonic, Tex.


The Debonairs appreciate the
support of all who made our an
nual dance a success.


All Debonairs take their hats
off to our vice president who took
over club leadership so quickly
when our president Mrs. Demtra
Vann was called out Of the city
because Of her fathers illness.


We congratulate vice president
Bessie Cook and hope Demtra will
hurry home.


Mr.. and Mrs. Wesley Conner
and their family motored to Flag
staff to enjoy the all Indian pow
WOW.


The new growth of the year--a
young lady in her twenties Is cut
ting teeth. She had one pulled and
another Is coming out. This
seems to run In the family--the
same thing has happened to one
of her sisters.


Give me a call for news items
in this column: days AL. 8-05ll
and 258-OOO5 evenings.

If you re watching your weight.
but can't resist snacks, the US.
Department of Agriculture sug-
gests you MUNICH carrot strips,
celery, caulif1ower, or melba
toast.


If you crave something sweet.
try whatever fresh fruits are in
season. strawberries, pears,
peaches, a strip of cantaloupe
or watermelon. They're high on
taste and nutrition and low on
calorieS.

full articles.headline: Weight Tips
full articles.article:
If you re watching your weight.
but can't resist snacks, the US.

gests you MUNICH carrot strips,
celery, caulif1ower, or melba
toast.


If you crave something sweet.
